lead_paragraph: More than a third of voters ages 18 to 29 say they will vote for a third-party candidate, and when asked to choose a major-party nominee, 10 percent said they would not vote.

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS and YAMICHE ALCINDOR

headline.print_headline: Clinton Struggles to Win Back  Young Voters From 3rd Parties
headline.main: Hillary Clinton Struggles to Win Back Young Voters From Third Parties

snippet: More than a third of voters ages 18 to 29 say they will vote for a third-party candidate, and when asked to choose a major-party nominee, 10 percent said they would not vote....
abstract: Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign holds several events targeting millennial voters, highlighting how she has struggled to attract important voting bloc to her candidacy; more than third of voters ages 18 to 29 say in poll they will vote for third-party candidate, and when asked to choose a major-party nominee, 10 percent said they would not vote.
